comments:
This course explains in non-mathematical terms how all biological properties are
determined by the microscopic chemical properties of proteins. It also explains how
research results, especially those of structural biology, are presented to various audiences.
Students had mixed opinions on this course. A few found the points made in class
“interesting,” and readings “valuable.” On the other hand, some found the subject matter
“inane,” but still believed that the course encouraged “self-motivation and curiosity.”
Students generally found Professor Lu to be “brilliant” but “absolutely insane.”
Many, however, appreciated his “different perspectives” in the sciences.
Many students found the workload overwhelming claiming that they “put more
effort into this course than my other 4.5 credits combined.” The quizzes seem
“idiosyncratic” in nature. Many also disliked waking up for the 8 AM classes. Most
students advised this course to not be taken unless they are part of the Vagelos MLS
program.
